description.plain:
KONGOS is a South African-born American alternative rock band consisting of four brothers: Johnny (accordion, keyboards, vocals), Jesse (drums, percussion, vocals), Daniel (guitar, vocals), and Dylan Kongos (bass guitar, lap slide guitar, vocals). The four members are the sons of recording artist John Kongos.

Their album Lunatic topped various South African charts, and the singles “I’m Only Joking” and “Come with Me Now” gained attention in the United States sometime later.

body.plain:
KONGOS is a South African-born American alternative rock band consisting of four brothers: Johnny (accordion, keyboards, vocals), Jesse (drums, percussion, vocals), Daniel (guitar, vocals), and Dylan Kongos (bass guitar, lap slide guitar, vocals). The four members are the sons of recording artist John Kongos.

Their album Lunatic topped various South African charts, and the singles “I’m Only Joking” and “Come with Me Now” gained attention in the United States sometime later.

songs.full_title: Come with Me Now by KONGOS
songs.title: Come with Me Now

description.plain:
“Come With Me Now” is the first main single from Lunatic Its by the four sons of South-African artist Lineup 2014. It’s about seizing the day by losing control.

Even though it was released in 2011, it became popular after finding ad spots with “The Originals” and NBC Sports. It recieved renewed attention in 2016, when it was featured in Amazon Prime’s advertising campain for their show “The Grand Tour”.

Even though it was released in 2011, it became popular after finding ad spots with “The Originals” and NBC Sports. It recieved renewed attention in 2016, when it was featured in Amazon Prime’s advertising campain for their show “The Grand Tour”.

songs.title: I’m Only Joking

description.plain: “I’m Only Joking” is the opening track of the Kongos' debut album, Lunatics. The band members spit out celestial-related imagery and troll the listeners.

songs.embed_content: Read “I'm Only Joking” by KONGOS on Genius

body.plain: “I’m Only Joking” is the opening track of the Kongos' debut album, Lunatics. The band members spit out celestial-related imagery and troll the listeners.

songs.title: Repeat after Me

description.plain:
“Repeat After Me” is the second to last track of Kongos' 2016 album Egomaniac. The track is a notable departure from the band’s usual style, with rhythmically spoken verses contrasting against a melodic chorus.

In a subtle critique of religion, the song’s lyrics are packed with religious metaphors and references, especially references and allusions to Christian theology, tradition, and history. Even the official lyric video prominently displays Egyptian symbology in reference to the Book of Exodus.

songs.embed_content: Read “Repeat after Me” by KONGOS on Genius

body.plain:
“Repeat After Me” is the second to last track of Kongos' 2016 album Egomaniac. The track is a notable departure from the band’s usual style, with rhythmically spoken verses contrasting against a melodic chorus.

In a subtle critique of religion, the song’s lyrics are packed with religious metaphors and references, especially references and allusions to Christian theology, tradition, and history. Even the official lyric video prominently displays Egyptian symbology in reference to the Book of Exodus.

songs.lyrics:
12 ContributorsRepeat after Me Lyrics[Chorus]
If I could breathe, I'd be free
And I'd get high, I'd turn water to wine
If I could be, I'd breathe free at last

Wearing the veil, seeking the grail
Wall where you wail, and musical scales

Stoned if you don't believe, only fuck to conceive
